name: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze
author: Dani
summary: This is a fantastic Bundt cake that my grandmother used to make for Thanksgiving. It has been a family favorite for years!
ingredients: 2 medium Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and chopped
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a large bowl, beat the sugar, oil, vanilla and eggs with an electric mixer until light and fluffy
Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt; stir into the batter just until blended
Fold in the apples and walnuts using a spoon
Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted into the crown or the cake comes out clean
Allow to cool for about 20 minutes then invert on to a wire rack
Make the glaze by heating the butter, milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat
Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar, then remove from the heat
I like to place a sheet of aluminum foil under the cooling rack to catch the drips for easy clean up
